Enum Class CardEffect

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Enum<CardEffect>
model.cards.CardEffect
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<CardEffect>, Constable
public enum CardEffect extends Enum<CardEffect>
Defines the various special effects that can be associated with trophy cards in the Jest game. Each effect determines how a trophy card is awarded to a player based on different criteria evaluated at the end of the game.

Effect categories:

  • Sign-based: HIGHEST, LOWEST (target specific suit cards)
  • Value-based: MAJORITY (most cards of a specific value)
  • Joker-based: JOKER (requires having a Joker card)
  • Score-based: BEST_JEST, BEST_JEST_WITHOUT_JOKER
  • Quantity-based: MOST_CARDS, LEAST_CARDS (expansion)
  • Parity-based: EVEN_VALUES, ODD_VALUES (expansion)
  • Uniqueness-based: NO_DUPLICATES (expansion)

Each effect implements the CheckEffect(int, Sign, ArrayList) method to determine the winner of the trophy card.

See Also:

  • Player
  • Game

  • Enum Constant Summary

    Enum Constants
    Enum Constant
    Description
    BEST_JEST
    Awards the trophy to the player with the highest total Jest score.
    BEST_JEST_WITHOUT_JOKER
    Awards the trophy to the player with the highest total Jest score among players who do NOT have a Joker card.
    EVEN_VALUES
    Awards the trophy to the player with the most cards having even values (2, 4, 6, 8, etc.).
    HIGHEST
    Awards the trophy to the player with the highest value card of a specific suit.
    JOKER
    Awards the trophy to the first player who has a Joker card in their jest pile.
    LEAST_CARDS
    Awards the trophy to the player with the fewest total cards in their jest pile.
    LOWEST
    Awards the trophy to the player with the lowest value card of a specific suit.
    MAJORITY
    Awards the trophy to the player with the most cards of a specific value.
    MOST_CARDS
    Awards the trophy to the player with the most total cards in their jest pile.
    NO_DUPLICATES
    Awards the trophy to the first player who has no duplicate values in their jest pile.
    ODD_VALUES
    Awards the trophy to the player with the most cards having odd values (1, 3, 5, 7, etc.).

  • Enum Constant Details

    • HIGHEST

      public static final CardEffect HIGHEST
      Awards the trophy to the player with the highest value card of a specific suit.

      Requirements:

      • sign parameter must not be null
      • Player must have at least one card of the specified suit

    • LOWEST

      public static final CardEffect LOWEST
      Awards the trophy to the player with the lowest value card of a specific suit.

      Requirements:

      • sign parameter must not be null
      • Player must have at least one card of the specified suit

    • MAJORITY

      public static final CardEffect MAJORITY
      Awards the trophy to the player with the most cards of a specific value. For example, most cards with value 3, or most cards with value 7.

      Requirements:

      • value parameter must be between 1 and 4 (inclusive)
      • Player must have at least one card with the specified value

    • JOKER

      public static final CardEffect JOKER
      Awards the trophy to the first player who has a Joker card in their jest pile. If no player has a Joker, returns null.

      Note: This effect ignores the value and sign parameters.

    • BEST_JEST

      public static final CardEffect BEST_JEST
      Awards the trophy to the player with the highest total Jest score. Uses the standard Jest scoring rules to calculate points. In case of a tie, the last player checked wins.

      Note: This effect ignores the value and sign parameters.

    • BEST_JEST_WITHOUT_JOKER

      public static final CardEffect BEST_JEST_WITHOUT_JOKER
      Awards the trophy to the player with the highest total Jest score among players who do NOT have a Joker card. Players with Joker cards are excluded from consideration.

      Note: This effect ignores the value and sign parameters.

    • MOST_CARDS

      public static final CardEffect MOST_CARDS
      Awards the trophy to the player with the most total cards in their jest pile. This is an expansion pack effect.

      Note: This effect ignores the value and sign parameters.

    • LEAST_CARDS

      public static final CardEffect LEAST_CARDS
      Awards the trophy to the player with the fewest total cards in their jest pile. This is an expansion pack effect.

      Note: This effect ignores the value and sign parameters.

    • EVEN_VALUES

      public static final CardEffect EVEN_VALUES
      Awards the trophy to the player with the most cards having even values (2, 4, 6, 8, etc.). Only SuitCards are considered; Joker cards are ignored. This is an expansion pack effect.

      Note: This effect ignores the value and sign parameters.

    • ODD_VALUES

      public static final CardEffect ODD_VALUES
      Awards the trophy to the player with the most cards having odd values (1, 3, 5, 7, etc.). Only SuitCards are considered; Joker cards are ignored. This is an expansion pack effect.

      Note: This effect ignores the value and sign parameters.

    • NO_DUPLICATES

      public static final CardEffect NO_DUPLICATES
      Awards the trophy to the first player who has no duplicate values in their jest pile. A player qualifies if all their SuitCards have unique values. Joker cards are ignored in the uniqueness check. This is an expansion pack effect.

      Note: This effect ignores the value and sign parameters.

    • valueOf

      public static CardEffect valueOf(String name)
      Returns the enum constant of this class with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this class. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the enum constant to be returned.
      Returns:
      the enum constant with the specified name
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if this enum class has no constant with the specified name
      NullPointerException - if the argument is null

    • CheckEffect

      public abstract Player CheckEffect(int value, Sign sign, ArrayList<Player> players)
      Evaluates the effect condition and determines which player wins the trophy. Each effect constant implements this method with its specific logic.

      Parameter usage varies by effect:

      • HIGHEST, LOWEST: require sign parameter
      • MAJORITY: requires value parameter (1-4)
      • Other effects: ignore value and sign parameters
      Parameters:
      value - the value parameter for effects that use it (e.g., MAJORITY)
      sign - the sign parameter for effects that use it (e.g., HIGHEST, LOWEST)
      players - the list of all players to evaluate
      Returns:
      the Player who wins the trophy, or null if no player qualifies
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if sign is required but null
      IllegalArgumentException - if value is required but out of valid range
